head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Court Clerk Arrested On Drug Charges

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Court Clerk Arrested On Drug Charges

body.head.byline: By Jacob H. Fries (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: 54-year-old Dennis Bram, clerk at New York State Supreme Court in Brooklyn, is arrested for allegedly selling marijuana out of courthouse; is suspended without pay (S)

block.p: A Supreme Court clerk has been charged with selling marijuana out of the courthouse in downtown Brooklyn, the authorities said. The clerk, Dennis Bram, 54, who has worked at the court since 1982, was charged with criminal sale of marijuana, a spokesman for the Brooklyn district attorney's office said on Thursday. On Jan. 23, an undercover informant bought about $60 worth of marijuana from Mr. Bram and later bought marijuana worth $2,500, the spokesman said. Mr. Bram, who made $73,138 a year as a senior clerk, has been suspended without pay.
